com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom
Class FlatGeometry

java.lang.Object
  com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom.AbstractGeometry
      com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom.FlatGeometry
All Implemented Interfaces:
Geometry
public class FlatGeometry
extends AbstractGeometry
implements Geometry

Concrete class providing a flat geometry (in the XY-plane, with Z up).

Version:
$Id: FlatGeometry.java,v 1.2 2006/07/06 06:58:35 martin Exp $
Author:
martin

Method Detail

getHeight

public float getHeight(XYZ p)
Get the height of a point in this geometry. In flat geometry the height is just the z co-ordinate of a point.

Specified by:
getHeight in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point representing the coordinates to be queried
Returns:
The height of the specified point relative to assumed sea level at 0.0

setHeight

public void setHeight(XYZ p,
                      float v)
Set the height of a point in this geometry. Setting a height is simply assigning to the z-coordinate as this is a flat geometry.

Specified by:
setHeight in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point with the height that is to be set
v - The new height to assign (relative to zero being sea level)

getMidpoint

public XYZ getMidpoint(XYZ v0,
                       XYZ v1)
The mid-point between two points is simply their average.

Specified by:
getMidpoint in interface Geometry
Parameters:
v0 - The first point
v1 - The second point
Returns:
The midpoint between the two points

getNormalisedLatitude

public float getNormalisedLatitude(XYZ p)
This doesn't really mean anything here, so return zero, which would correspond to the equator of a spherical geometry.

Specified by:
getNormalisedLatitude in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to get the latitude for
Returns:
The normalised latitude of the point

up

public XYZ up(XYZ p)
Returns unit z vector. (Up is the same everywhere in this geometry).

Specified by:
up in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to get the unit Z vector for
Returns:
The unit Z vector for this point

north

public XYZ north(XYZ p)
Returns unit y vector. (North is the same everywhere in this geometry).

east

public XYZ east(XYZ p)
Returns unit x vector. (East is the same everywhere in this geometry).

Specified by:

Returns:

perturb

public XYZ perturb(XYZ p,
                   XYZ variation)
Adds a random peturbation to a point up to the specified amount The correct thing to do would be to return p+RandomXYZInEllipsoid(_r01,variation); however, this uses a variable number of random number calls which means small parameter changes can have big effects on generated terrain. This, on the other hand, always uses the same number of random numbers, but isn't statistically equivalent *

Specified by:
perturb in interface Geometry
Parameters:
p - The point to be subjected to peturbation
variation - The maximum amount of random variation to appy
Returns:
A new peturbed point. The input value is not modified

epsilon

public float epsilon()
Returns zero. Heights are stored exactly once assigned so no need for non-zero epsilon

Specified by:
epsilon in interface Geometry
Returns:
The epsilon value for this geometry, always zero for the flat case
